titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Centennial Celebration of the Evacuation of the City of New-York by the British collection 1977.079
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T15:37-0500

did.unittitle: Centennial Celebration of the Evacuation of the City of New-York by the British collection

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Joint Committee on the Centennial Celebration of the Evacuation of New York by the British.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Centennial Celebration of the Evacuation of the City of New-York by the British was held in 1883 to commemorate the evacuation of British forces from New York after their defeat by the Continental Army in the Revolutionary War.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Centennial Celebration of the Evacuation of the City of New-York by the British collection, 1977.079, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains programs, newspapers and periodicals, posters, and souvenirs relating to the Centennial Celebration of the Evacuation of the City of New-York by the British in 1883, and minutes of the celebration's organizing committee.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of John Austin Stevens, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

controlaccess.corpname: Joint Committee on the Centennial Celebration of the Evacuation of New York by the British.
